Indeed, the third affliction is plunging into falsehood [al-batil], and it is speech concerning sins, such as recounting the states of women, gatherings of wine, the stations of the dissolute, the luxuries of the wealthy, the tyranny of kings and their blameworthy customs and their detestable conditions. For all of that is from what it is not permissible to plunge into, and it is forbidden. Most people sit together for amusement through conversation, and their speech does not go beyond jesting with the honor of people or plunging into falsehood [al-batil]. The types of falsehood [al-batil] cannot be enumerated due to their multitude and variety; therefore, there is no deliverance from them except by restricting oneself to what is of concern from the important matters of religion [din] and the world [dunya]. And the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "The greatest of people in sins on the Day of Resurrection will be the one who plunges most into falsehood [al-batil]." And to this is the allusion by His saying, the Exalted: "And we used to plunge with those who plunge." And by His saying, the Exalted: "Then do not sit with them until they plunge into a discourse other than it; indeed, you would then be like them." And Salman said: "The greatest of people in sins on the Day of Resurrection will be the one who speaks most in disobedience to Allah." So this is plunging into falsehood [al-batil], and it is beyond what will come of backbiting, tale-bearing, obscenity, and others. Rather, it is plunging into the mention of prohibitions whose occurrence has preceded, or contemplating to find a way to them, without a religious need to mention them. And there also enters into it plunging into recounting innovations and corrupt doctrines, and recounting what occurred of the fighting among the Companions in a manner that suggests disparagement of some of them. And all of that is falsehood [al-batil], and plunging into it is plunging into falsehood [al-batil]. We ask Allah for good assistance through His gentleness and generosity.

Vol 4: Watchfulness and Self-Examination
What is this from the signs of faith (Iman) if faith were by the tongue alone? Then why were the hypocrites (Al-Munafiqun) in the lowest depth (Al-Dark Al-Asfal) of the Fire? Woe to you, O Soul (Nafs)! It is as if you do not believe in the Day of Reckoning (Yawm Al-Hisab) and you think that if you die, you will escape and be freed. Far from it! Do you reckon that you will be left neglected? Were you not a drop of semen (Nutfah) emitted? Then you were a clinging clot (Alaqah), then He created and proportioned. Is not That One capable of reviving the dead? If this is from your hidden thoughts, then how disbelieving (Kafir) and ignorant you are!

Whenever the rulers are oppressive and the judge is unable to judge except by flattering them and neglecting some rights for their sake and for the sake of those attached to them, since he knows that if he judged them with truth they would remove him or not obey him, then it is not for him to assume the judgeship. And if he assumes it, then upon him is to demand the rights from them, and fear of removal should not be an excuse permitting him in neglect at all. Rather, if he is removed, the responsibility falls from him. He should rejoice in the removal if he was judging for Allah. If his soul (Nafs) does not permit that, then he is indeed judging for following the caprice (Hawa) and the Satan (Shaytan). So how can he expect reward? And he is with the oppressors in the lowest depth (Al-Dark Al-Asfal) of the Fire. 'Indeed, the hypocrites will be in the lowest depth (Al-Dark Al-Asfal) of the Fire, and never will you find for them a helper.'

a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol 4: Intention, Sincerity, and Truthfulness
The Virtue of Sincerity (Ikhlas). Allah the Exalted said: 'And they were not commanded except to worship Allah, [being] sincere to Him in religion' (Quran 98:5). And He said: 'Unquestionably, for Allah is the pure religion' (Quran 39:3). And Allah the Exalted said: 'Except those who repent, correct [their affairs], hold fast to Allah, and purify their religion for Allah; for those will be with the believers. And Allah is going to give the believers a great reward' (Quran 4:146). And Allah the Exalted said: 'So whoever would hope for the meeting with his Lord - let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone' (Quran 18:110). This was revealed concerning one who acts for Allah but loves to be praised for it. And the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'Three things, the Heart (Qalb) of a Muslim man does not harbor malice regarding them: sincerity of action for Allah' [36]. And from Mus'ab ibn Sa'd from his father, he said: My father thought he had superiority over those below him among the companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, so the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'Indeed, Allah the Mighty and Majestic supports this nation through its weak ones, their supplication, and their sincerity' [37]. And from Al-Hasan, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'Allah the Exalted says: Sincerity (Ikhlas) is a secret from My secrets; I have deposited it in the Heart (Qalb) of whom I love from My servants' [38]. And 'Ali ibn Abi Talib, may Allah honor his face, said: 'Do not be concerned with the smallness of the action, but be concerned with acceptance, for the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to Mu'adh ibn Jabal: Purify the action, and a little of it will suffice you' [39]. And he, peace be upon him, said: 'There is no servant who purifies his action for Allah for forty days except that the springs of Wisdom (Hikmah) appear from his Heart (Qalb) upon his tongue' [40]. And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'The first to be questioned on the Day of Resurrection are three: a man whom Allah gave knowledge, so Allah the Exalted says: What did you do with what you knew? He says: My Lord, I would stand [in prayer] during the night and the ends of the day. So Allah the Exalted says: You have lied, and the angels say: You have lied, rather...'

Indeed, except those who repent and reform and hold fast to Allah and make their religion [din] pure for Allah. The virtue of sincerity [ikhlas]. Allah, the Exalted, said: "And they were not commanded except to worship Allah, making their religion [din] pure for Him." And He said: "Indeed, the pure religion [din] is for Allah." And He, the Exalted, said: "Except those who repent and reform and hold fast to Allah and make their religion [din] pure for Allah." And He, the Exalted, said: "So whoever hopes for the meeting with his Lord, let him do righteous work and not associate in the worship of his Lord anyone." This was revealed concerning one who acts for Allah but loves to be praised for it. And the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Three things against which the heart [qalb] of a believing man is not sealed: sincerity [ikhlas] of action for Allah." And from Mus'ab ibn Sa'd, from his father, who said: My father thought he had virtue over those beneath him among the companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. So the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed, Allah, Mighty and Majestic, grants victory to this nation through its weak ones, their supplication, and their sincerity [ikhlas]." And from Al-Hasan, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Allah, the Exalted, says: 'Sincerity [ikhlas] is a secret from My secrets; I have deposited it in the heart [qalb] of whom I love from My servants.'" And 'Ali ibn Abi Talib, may Allah honor his face, said: "Do not concern yourselves with the smallness of the action, but concern yourselves with its acceptance. For the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to Mu'adh ibn Jabal: 'Make the action sincere [ikhlas], and a little of it will suffice you.'" And he, peace be upon him, said: "There is no servant who makes his action sincere [ikhlas] for Allah for forty days except that the springs of wisdom [hikma] will appear from his heart [qalb] upon his tongue." And he, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The first to be questioned on the Day of Resurrection are three: A man whom Allah granted knowledge ['ilm]. Allah will say: 'What did you do with what you knew?' He will say: 'My Lord, I would stand in prayer at night and by day.' Allah will say: 'You have lied.' And the angels will say: 'You have lied. Rather, you wanted it to be said: So-and-so is a scholar. Behold, it was said.' And a man whom Allah granted wealth. Allah will say: 'I have bestowed favor upon you, so what did you do?' He will say: 'My Lord, I would give charity with it at night and by day.' Allah will say: 'You have lied.' And the angels will say: 'You have lied. Rather, you wanted it to be said: So-and-so is generous. Behold, it was said.' And a man who was killed in the path of Allah. Allah will say: 'What did you do?' He will say: 'My Lord, You commanded jihad, so I fought until I was killed.' Allah will say: 'You have lied.' And the angels will say: 'You have lied. Rather, you wanted it to be said: So-and-so is courageous. Behold, it was said.'" Abu Huraira said: Then the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, struck my thigh and said: "O Abu Huraira, those are the first of creation for whom the fire of Hell [Jahannam] will be kindled on the Day of Resurrection."

Know that Allah the Exalted coupled Gratitude (Shukr) with Remembrance (Dhikr) in His Book, even though He said: 'And the Remembrance (Dhikr) of Allah is greater' (Quran 29:45). So He the Exalted said: 'So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me' (Quran 2:152). And He the Exalted said: 'What would Allah do with your punishment if you are grateful and believe?' (Quran 4:147). And He the Exalted said: 'And We will reward the grateful ones' (Quran 3:145). And He the Mighty and Majestic informed about Iblis the accursed: 'I will surely sit in wait for them on Your straight path' (Quran 7:16). It is said it is the path of Gratitude (Shukr), and due to the high rank of Gratitude (Shukr), the accursed one disparaged the creation, saying: 'And you will not find most of them grateful' (Quran 7:17). And He the Exalted said: 'And few of My servants are grateful' (Quran 34:13). And Allah the Exalted affirmed increase with Gratitude (Shukr) without exception, saying: 'If you are grateful, I will surely increase you' (Quran 14:7). And He made exceptions in five things: in enrichment, response, provision, forgiveness, and repentance, saying: 'Then Allah will enrich you from His bounty if He wills' (Quran 9:28), and said: 'And He removes what you call to if He wills' (Quran 42:30), and said: 'He provides for whom He wills without account' (Quran 2:212), and said: 'And He forgives what is less than that for whom He wills' (Quran 4:48), and said: 'And Allah turns in forgiveness to whom He wills' (Quran 9:27). And it is a character from the characters of Lordship (Rububiyyah), as He the Exalted said: 'And Allah is Appreciative (Shakur) and Forbearing' (Quran 64:17). And Allah made Gratitude (Shukr) the key to the speech of the people of Paradise, saying: 'And they will say, "Praise to Allah, who has fulfilled for us His promise"' (Quran 39:74), and said: 'And their last call will be, "Praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds"' (Quran 10:10).

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Patience and Gratitude
Know that God the Exalted has coupled gratitude [shukr] with remembrance [dhikr] in His Book, even though He has said: "And the remembrance of God is greater." Indeed, He the Exalted said: "So remember Me; I will remember you. And be grateful to Me and do not deny Me." And He the Exalted said: "What would God do with your punishment if you are grateful and believe?" And He the Exalted said: "And We will reward the grateful." And He, Mighty and Majestic, said, informing about the accursed Iblis: "I will surely sit in ambush for them on Your straight path." It is said this is the path of gratitude [shukr]. And due to the exalted rank of gratitude [shukr], the accursed one assailed creation, saying: "And You will not find most of them grateful." And He the Exalted said: "And few of My servants are grateful." And God the Exalted has decreed increase with gratitude [shukr] without exception, for He the Exalted said: "If you are grateful, I will surely increase you."

a.g: Allah does not like the public mention of evil except by one who has been wronged. And ever is Allah Hearing and Knowing.
If [instead] you show [some] good or conceal it or pardon an offense - indeed, Allah is ever Pardoning and Competent.

Indeed, those who disbelieve in Allah and His messengers and wish to discriminate between Allah and His messengers and say, "We believe in some and disbelieve in others," and wish to adopt a way in between -
Those are the disbelievers, truly. And We have prepared for the disbelievers a humiliating punishment.
But they who believe in Allah and His messengers and do not discriminate between any of them - to those He is going to give their rewards. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.

The People of the Scripture ask you to bring down to them a book from the heaven. But they had asked of Moses [even] greater than that and said, "Show us Allah outright," so the thunderbolt struck them for their wrongdoing. Then they took the calf [for worship] after clear evidences had come to them, and We pardoned that. And We gave Moses a clear authority.

And We raised over them the mount for [refusal of] their covenant; and We said to them, "Enter the gate bowing humbly", and We said to them, "Do not transgress on the sabbath", and We took from them a solemn covenant.

And [We cursed them] for their breaking of the covenant and their disbelief in the signs of Allah and their killing of the prophets without right and their saying, "Our hearts are wrapped". Rather, Allah has sealed them because of their disbelief, so they believe not, except for a few.
And [We cursed them] for their disbelief and their saying against Mary a great slander,

And [for] their saying, "Indeed, we have killed the Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, the messenger of Allah." And they did not kill him, nor did they crucify him; but [another] was made to resemble him to them. And indeed, those who differ over it are in doubt about it. They have no knowledge of it except the following of assumption. And they did not kill him, for certain.
Rather, Allah raised him to Himself. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.
And there is none from the People of the Scripture but that he will surely believe in Jesus before his death. And on the Day of Resurrection he will be against them a witness.
For wrongdoing on the part of the Jews, We made unlawful for them [certain] good foods which had been lawful to them, and for their averting from the way of Allah many [people],
And [for] their taking of usury while they had been forbidden from it, and their consuming of the people's wealth unjustly. And we have prepared for the disbelievers among them a painful punishment.

But those firm in knowledge among them and the believers believe in what has been revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and what was revealed before you. And the establishers of prayer [especially] and the givers of zakah and the believers in Allah and the Last Day - those We will give a great reward.

Indeed, We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], as We revealed to Noah and the prophets after him. And we revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, the Descendants, Jesus, Job, Jonah, Aaron, and Solomon, and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].
And [We sent] messengers about whom We have related [their stories] to you before and messengers about whom We have not related to you. And Allah spoke to Moses with [direct] speech.
[We sent] messengers as bringers of good tidings and warners so that mankind will have no argument against Allah after the messengers. And ever is Allah Exalted in Might and Wise.
But Allah bears witness to that which He has revealed to you. He has sent it down with His knowledge, and the angels bear witness [as well]. And sufficient is Allah as Witness.
Indeed, those who disbelieve and avert [people] from the way of Allah have certainly gone far astray.
Indeed, those who disbelieve and commit wrong [or injustice] - never will Allah forgive them, nor will He guide them to a path.
Except the path of Hell; they will abide therein forever. And that, for Allah, is [always] easy.

O Mankind, the Messenger has come to you with the truth from your Lord, so believe; it is better for you. But if you disbelieve - then indeed, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. And ever is Allah Knowing and Wise.

O People of the Scripture, do not commit excess in your religion or say about Allah except the truth. The Messiah, Jesus, the son of Mary, was but a messenger of Allah and His word which He directed to Mary and a soul [created at a command] from Him. So believe in Allah and His messengers. And do not say, "Three"; desist - it is better for you. Indeed, Allah is but one God. Exalted is He above having a son. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.

Go to Jesus (Isa), peace be upon him. So they come to Jesus and say: O Jesus, you are the Messenger of Allah and His Word (Kalimah) which He cast to Mary and a Spirit (Ruh) from Him, and you spoke to people in the cradle. Intercede for us to your Lord, do you not see what we are in? Then Jesus, peace be upon him, says: Indeed my Lord has become angry today with an anger like which He has not become angry before and will not become angry after, and he does not mention a sin. Myself, myself, go to another, go to Muhammad ï·º.

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Condemnation of Pride and Conceit
The first division: Arrogance (Takabbur) towards Allah; and that is the most vile of types of arrogance, and its source is nothing but pure ignorance (Jahl) and transgression (Tughyan) like what was from Nimrod, for he would tell himself that he would fight the Lord of the heavens, and as is narrated about a group of the ignorant. Rather, what is narrated about everyone who claimed lordship (Rububiyyah) like Pharaoh and others, for due to his arrogance he said: 'I am your highest lord,' since he disdained (Istankafa) to be a servant (Abd) of Allah, and therefore Allah the Exalted said: 'Indeed, those who are arrogant (Yastakbirun) about My worship (Ibadati) will enter Hell in humiliation,' and Allah the Exalted said: 'Never will the Messiah disdain (Yastankif) to be a servant (Abd) of Allah nor the angels brought near (Al-Muqarrabun),' the verse, and Allah the Exalted said: 'And when it is said to them: Prostrate to the Most Merciful (Al-Rahman), they say: And what is the Most Merciful? Shall we prostrate to that which you order us?' and it increased them in aversion.

ğŸ“– Vol 3: Condemnation of Pride and Conceit
Know that the one upon whom arrogance is directed is Allah the Exalted, or His messengers, or the rest of His creation. And He created the human being as oppressive and ignorant. So sometimes he becomes arrogant towards the creation and sometimes towards the Creator. Therefore, arrogance, with consideration to the one upon whom it is directed, is of three divisions: The first: Arrogance towards Allah; and that is the most vile of the types of arrogance, and it has no source except pure ignorance and transgression, like what was from Nimrod, for he would converse with himself about fighting the Lord of the heavens, and as is narrated about a group of the ignorant. Rather, what is narrated about everyone who claimed lordship, like Pharaoh and others, for due to his arrogance he said: 'I am your highest lord,' since he disdained to be a slave (abd) of Allah. And for that reason, Allah the Exalted said: 'Indeed, those who are arrogant towards My worship will enter Hell in humiliation.' And Allah the Exalted said: 'Never will the Messiah disdain to be a slave (abd) of Allah, nor the angels brought near.' The verse. And Allah the Exalted said: 'And when it is said to them: Prostrate to the Most Merciful, they say: And what is the Most Merciful? Shall we prostrate to that which you order us?' And it increased them in aversion.

a.g: And as for those who believed and did righteous deeds, He will give them in full their rewards and grant them extra from His bounty. But as for those who disdained and were arrogant, He will punish them with a painful punishment, and they will not find for themselves besides Allah any protector or helper.
O mankind, there has come to you a conclusive proof from your Lord, and We have sent down to you a clear light.
So those who believe in Allah and hold fast to Him - He will admit them to mercy from Himself and bounty and guide them to Himself on a straight path.

They request from you a [legal] ruling. Say, "Allah gives you a ruling concerning one having neither descendants nor ascendants [as heirs]." If a man dies, leaving no child but [only] a sister, she will have half of what he left. And he inherits from her if she [dies and] has no child. But if there are two sisters [or more], they will have two-thirds of what he left. If there are both brothers and sisters, the male will have the share of two females. Allah makes clear to you [His law], lest you go astray. And Allah is Knowing of all things.
